Legal Counsel – Volvo Group Connected Solutions

Volvo Group Connected Solutions is a global organization that leads the development of Volvo Group’s connected services and solutions of tomorrow. We work at the forefront of connectivity by collecting and analyzing data from over 1 100 000 customer vehicles and machines. Our solutions enables our customers to improve efficiency by leveraging vehicle data. Connectivity is also an enabler for Automation and Electromobility; both when it comes to technology and when it comes to services for these applications. Our services will increase transport and resource efficiency through optimized traffic flows and a higher utilization of existing infrastructure, benefits not only for our customers but also for the society. Connected vehicles and machines enables more environmentally friendly transport solutions.

Our organization is set-up to deliver competitive offerings, shorten time to market and provide an arena for new service innovations together with customers, partners and the Volvo Group (including e.g. Volvo Trucks, Renault Trucks, Volvo Construction Equipment, UD, Mack, Volvo Buses, Volvo Penta etc.) 

Role description

We are recruiting a Legal Counsel to provide global legal support to the Volvo Group Connected Solutions organization and to be a part of developing the objectives for the legal and compliance function. You will monitor, assess and handle legal and compliance risks within the area of designing, operating and supporting customer-oriented connected solutions and services for Volvo Group products. You will work in close co-operation with the technical and business organizations. You will report to the General Counsel Volvo Group Connected Solutions.

Key Responsibilities

	Provide high quality legal advice to the daily operations, including drafting and negotiating agreements, such as collaboration-, partnership-, development-, technology license- , IT-, joint venture- and M&A related agreements; support with respect to general data, data privacy and data security matters, IPR, open source, and also handle disputes and litigations, provide relevant trainings and supporting documents such as contract templates and guidelines
	Develop the objectives for the legal and compliance function
	Monitor, assess and handle legal and compliance risks
	Implement Volvo Group policies, strategies and procedures
	Collaborate with other legal functions within the Volvo Group
	Work effectively with and manage external legal resources
	Report to the General Counsel VGCS

Competence Profile & Qualifications

	Master’s degree or equivalent
	Around 5-10 years work experience
	Fluent in English
	Extensive experience in business/transaction management
	Solid knowledge within the legal fields of data and IPR
	Excellent analytical skills and proven ability to apply legal, business, technical and financial aspects in providing legal advice
	Strong business acumen and gravitas in internal and external meetings, have extensive experience of providing advice to senior and top level management
	Excellent communication and presentation skills
	Good judgment and strong personal credibility, integrity and creativity
	Successful in building excellent working relationships and operating effectively as a member of a leadership team
	Excellent professional skills and ability to work in a fast paced, multicultural and diverse environment
	International business experience is a merit
	Experience from software-, service-based and/or data-driven business is a merit

Location & Timeline

The position is based at Lindholmen in Gothenburg, Sweden. Occasional travel is expected.  The position is open and will be contracted as soon as possible. We will start screening as applications arrive, so don't hesitate to send yours. 

Want to know more? Contact us!

For more information please contact FIRSTNAME LASTNAME, General Counsel Volvo Group Connected Solutions,  TELEPHONENO .

Welcome to the heart of connectivity at Volvo Group Connected Solutions!
